text: Is there a good (as in numerically robust, and fast) SQP solver for NLP other than Knitro?

elements.text: Is there a good (as in numerically robust, and fast) SQP solver for NLP other than Knitro?

text:
apart of the SQP implemented in Knitro, you may want to have a look at:
• SNOPT: the reference SQP implementation, as implemented by Gill, Murray and Saunders. <https://web.stanford.edu/group/SOL/snopt.htm>
• WORHP: a relatively new solver for large-scale optimization, currently developed by the European Space Agency. <https://web.stanford.edu/group/SOL/snopt.htm>

elements.text: apart of the SQP implemented in Knitro, you may want to have a look at:
SNOPT: the reference SQP implementation, as implemented by Gill, Murray and Saunders.
WORHP: a relatively new solver for large-scale optimization, currently developed by the European Space Agency.

text:
I am currently writing a wrapper for WorHP but haven't found the motivation to to complete the JuMP interface.
WorHP is very robust but a bit slower than IpOpt. <https://github.com/freemin7/WorhpOpt.jl> <https://worhp.de/> has an free academic and evaluation license and is maintained by a research group of university so there is no huge pressure to charge people.
There is also which i discovered yesterday <https://github.com/giaf/hpipm> . There is also <https://github.com/omuses/hqp> but both have no Julia binding.
